main event: On October 6, 1957, an object described as a single white point of reflected light was observed climbing rapidly and passing directly overhead in Elmendorf, Alaska.
interesting points: The observation was made by six qualified observers from the 514th Air Intelligence Service Squadron., The object appeared as bright as most stars or planets., Weather conditions were optimum for observation with a full moon and a cloudless sky., The sighting duration was approximately five minutes., Comments in the report suggested the object could possibly be a satellite, aircraft, balloon, meteor, or missile.
sighted object: single white point of reflected light
witness description: qualified observers from the 514th Air Intelligence Service Squadron
